[Flying Talon](/Weapons.aspx?ID=255)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Crown of the Kobold King</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Crown of the Kobold King](/Sources.aspx?ID=148) pg. 115</row>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) This weapon is an Advanced melee weapon_

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 6 gp

**Damage** 1d4 P

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Category** Advanced

**Group** [Flail](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=7)
</row>

</column>

---

This weapon consists of a three-pronged barbed hook attached to a length of chain. It can be used as a melee weapon to stab at foes or hurled as a ranged weapon. Some [kobolds](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=18) are particularly fond of using flying talons, especially as a sort of badge of office above those who serve them.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).
